verse.roman:
ity unmatta-vaco gopyaḥ
kṛṣṇānveṣaṇa-kātarāḥ
līlā bhagavatas tās tā
hy anucakrus tad-ātmikāḥ

synonyms: iti—thus; unmatta—maddened; vacaḥ—speaking words; gopyaḥ—the gopīs; kṛṣṇa-anveṣaṇa—by searching for Kṛṣṇa; kātarāḥ—distraught; līlāḥ—the transcendental pastimes; bhagavataḥ—of Him, the Supreme Personality of Godhead; tāḥ tāḥ—each of them; hi—indeed; anucakruḥ—they acted out; tat-ātmikāḥ—becoming absorbed in thought of Him.
translation: Having spoken these words, the gopīs, distraught from searching for Kṛṣṇa, began to act out His various pastimes, fully absorbed in thoughts of Him.
